title: Chex Muddy Buddies Recipe
description: This Muddy Buddies party mix made with Chex cereal, chocolate, peanut butter, butter, vanilla, and sugar is a fun, sweet, and crunchy snack that's easy to make.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Trusted Brands: Recipes and Tips Chex® Party Mix Chex Muddy Buddies 4.9 (201) 139 Reviews 69 Photos Muddy Buddies are a fun, sweet, and crunchy cereal snack mix that's easy to make. Another popular name for this favorite mix is puppy food. Chow down — it's doggone good! Submitted by Chex Updated on November 25, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 69 69 69 69 Prep Time: 15 mins Total Time: 15 mins Servings: 18 Yield: 10 cups Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe This homemade muddy buddies recipe will quickly become a go-to treat, whether you’re giving it as gifts or enjoying it at home! How to Make Muddy Buddies You'll find a detailed ingredient list and step-by-step instructions in the recipe below, but let's go over the basics: My Hot Southern Mess What Are Muddy Buddies?  “Muddy buddies” (a.k.a. puppy chow) is the name for a homemade candy or snack that’s main ingredients include cereal, chocolate, peanut butter, and powdered sugar. General Mills sells their own version of the popular treat, but making it at home is a fun and easy activity for all ages.  How to Make Homemade Muddy Buddies Here’s a brief overview of what you can expect when you make this muddy buddies recipe:  Microwave the chocolate and peanut butter together, then stir in the vanilla. Pour the mixture over the cereal and toss until it’s completely coated. Transfer to a bag with powdered sugar and shake to coat. Allow the muddy buddies to cool and set on wax paper.  Recipe Tip Any combination of Chex cereals will work in this recipe. How to Store Muddy Buddies After the muddy buddies have cooled and set, store them in an airtight container at room temperature for up to a week. If you’d like to prep ahead for the holiday season, you can freeze the muddy buddies for up to two months.  Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise “This is a yummy treat that everybody loves,” according to Ilovebaking03865. “You can switch out the Chex flavors for your own touch!” “This is so easy and yummy,” raves Lea. “And versatile! I used butterscotch chips with the peanut butter mixture and poured over half of the cereal.” "This recipe turned out amazing,” says Jade. “Everybody loved it and the texture was fantastic.” Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 18 servings 3 cups Rice Chex cereal 3 cups Corn Chex cereal 3 cups Chocolate Chex cereal 1 cup semisweet chocolate chips ½ cup peanut butter ¼ cup butter or margarine 1 teaspoon vanilla 1 ½ cups powdered sugar Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Combine all cereals in a large bowl; set aside. Place chocolate chips, peanut butter, and butter in a 1-quart microwave-safe bowl. Microwave, uncovered, on high for 1 minute, then stir. Continue warming mixture until smooth and combined, about 30 seconds longer. Stir in vanilla. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Pour chocolate mixture over cereal and stir until evenly coated. Transfer to a 2-gallon resealable plastic bag. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Add powdered sugar to the bag and seal; shake until well-coated. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Evenly spread cereal out onto waxed paper to cool. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook’s Note Store Muddy Buddies in an airtight container in the refrigerator. I Made It Print 705 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 206 Calories 9g Fat 31g Carbs 3g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 18 Calories 206 % Daily Value * Total Fat 9g 12% Saturated Fat 4g 20% Cholesterol 7mg 2% Sodium 192mg 8% Total Carbohydrate 31g 11% Dietary Fiber 1g 4% Total Sugars 18g Protein 3g 6% Calcium 7mg 1% Iron 0mg 2% Potassium 94mg 2% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Chex Muddy Buddies 01 of 69 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 69 Photo by  Baker Mandy 12/23/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Crowd-pleaser Worth the effort Family favorite I added, 1/2 tsp of salt, almond extract and vanilla extract. It tasted amazing. Used sugar free peanut butter and semi sweet chips and it was still sweet enough for me. 03 of 69 Photo by  ambedore81 05/06/2021 04 of 69 Photo by  Carla Gonzalez 12/18/2020 05 of 69 Photo by  jlroy1984 12/06/2020 06 of 69 Photo by  Theresa Simington 11/25/2020 07 of 69 Photo by  Liz Lambrakos Bastian 10/30/2020 Easy and good!!! Made a decent amount. Super quick and easy to make. I made this for a Halloween party. I mixed in pretzels and m&ms too for some additional salty sweet! 08 of 69 Photo by  Crystal Babcock 10/24/2020 09 of 69 Photo by  Sara 10/17/2020 10 of 69 Photo by  Jessica T Welch 08/09/2020 So yummy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Combine all cereals in a large bowl; set aside.;Place chocolate chips, peanut butter, and butter in a 1-quart microwave-safe bowl. Microwave, uncovered, on high for 1 minute, then stir. Continue warming mixture until smooth and combined, about 30 seconds longer. Stir in vanilla. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Pour chocolate mixture over cereal and stir until evenly coated. Transfer to a 2-gallon resealable plastic bag. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Add powdered sugar to the bag and seal; shake until well-coated. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Evenly spread cereal out onto waxed paper to cool. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios
